Fields.DialogueText: Gojuu! *Slash* Gojuuichi! *Slash* Gojuuni! *Slash* Gojuusan! *Slash* Gojuuyon! *Slash*
What are you doing up this early, I-7? The sun isn't even out yet.
Kanchou!!! The sun does not need to be out! What needs to be drawn is my sword, my blade, and soul! I am a warriorrrrr!!!

Fields.MenuText: Woah, easy there, tora.
I-7, sokudo wo otoshitekudasai.
This wouldn't happen to be what I think it is, is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Easy!? Yasashiidano!? Sore wa chigau! You are wrong! To take things easy is to drop into a grave easy! I will not stand for it, not now, not ever!
Hanasunaide! I shall continue practicing until I've slain 100 effigy! That way, I will have memorized one hundred cuts, and can better slice the enemy into pieces!
U-Uah? Nani wo hanashimasu ka? This is only for... intense training! Yes! This is for intense training to become a stronger warrior, and nothing more!
I-7, I-7... *DON*Yametekudasai yo. Come on, tell me what's going on? You're positively frazzled.
Ha. I-7, you know I can see right through you?
W-Wha!? How dare you insinuate me as having an ulterior motive! How dare you! I d-do not!
Uah! K-Kanchou... You used your bokuto to catch Koukinjitsu! Grrr... Hai. Kuyashi...
Embarrassing? What's so embarrassing? ... Oh, I think I know now. They assigned another Belle to protect Kure for the time being.
Yes! I am feeling rage! How dare they do such a thing, do not they know my mettle to Kure!? Why would they take that away from me!?
I-7, I-7... Please, I'm certain they didn't mean anything to you by it. Just to make sure of that, I'll draft a letter to them to see what's going on.
Tegami wo kakimasuka? Honto...? Ah, Kanchou... Your kindness shines through once again. But... the hurt still festers in my breast. What should we do?
I say we get in some practice. I think your slashing has attracted Morgana.
Heh! Yuurei no inu ga... I shall cleave them in two like everything else! Kanchou, junbi wa dekimasu ka?
Have at it.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, what is that in your hands?
The other thing I have here - the main thing - is a letter from the Prime Minister. We're to leave for Hokkaido right away.
Don't they have any Belles up there? Why are they not defending?
I don't know who's already up there - but it's obvious that they need us, I-7.
Hai... Wakarimashita...
Don't worry, I-7, we'll figure it out. Oh! Looks like a Morgana has wandered into our waters.
Sou desu ka? Well... Kiru no toki desu yo.
@BATTLE
Funayūrei are moving on Hakodate? Or one of the more northern ports?
It's stranger than that. There've been an unusual number of reports of them in more remote regions - and hints of atypical weather patterns, which is never good.
More remote regions? Kanchou, respectfully, who is making these reports?
Our orders don't go into a lot of depth - but it sounds like small Ainu communities. Or hunting parties, maybe.
Throwbacks in the woods, hiding from civilization - not the most reliable witnesses, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: The government is taking them seriously.
Take it easy, I-7.
We'll see for ourselves soon enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure the Prime Minister wants to give them every chance to prove they can be good Japanese! It's an old story, Kanchou, and it always leads to disappointment.
Hanasunai da yo, Kanchou. This is an outrage! Why must I be moved from Kure?! Because tattooed wild men saw shapes in the mist and panicked? This is an insult!
If they're so afraid of the Funayūrei, they should just move to the cities! Work to be part of Japanese society instead of clinging to primitive ways that stopped working for them centuries ago!
It's not our job to judge them. It's our job to go deal with Morganas.
Hai! At Kure! Where they're a threat to Japanese lives and culture! Off at the periphery, how much harm can they do? Oh, no, they'll scare the bears!
Listen, never mind our orders for now. I'm asking you to do this for me, okay? I've seen what happens when you leave Morganas alone at the peripheries, and it doesn't end well.
Incoming traffic to Hakodate has plummeted in the last few weeks, too. They could be looking at a 40% drop in trade and shipping by the end of the month.
Two things. First is an after-action report on another Kanchou's  latest campaign...
Very good. What else?
Mou... Stuck out here on this crass assignment, without many challenges, and new heights... No, instead I am half-past Niigata. If only I could just surf and have Kanchou see my impressive skill...
I hope I'm not disturbing you.
Kuah! Mou, Kanchou, nani yatten da yo!? Do you think that sneaking up on me will do you any favors! You are quite lucky that I did not have Koukinjitsu drawn; what gives you the right!?

Fields.MenuText: You look a bit flushed, I-7.
What's with that reaction?
Gomen, gomen. I came to check up on you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kuh... It is simply because I have been training a lot. Y-You are mistaken.
It is a normal reaction! K-Kuh... You are the one who is sneaking up on me! You and your cheekiness are going to get you cut! Hmph! I-Inconsiderate...
Mou chotto muzui! Cho-tto muzui! Do not sneak up on me then! Announce your presence respectfully! B-But... thank you for checking on me. I am quite fine.
Again, my apologies. I just saw you out here looking kind of sad and so I wanted to talk.
Well! I still do not like the circumstances that we are in and I do not appreciate... Kuh... Kanchou, kotaette kudasai.
Take your time.
Why do you think that they chose those Belles to protect Kure over me?
I think it's more that we were chosen to hunt Morganas over those other ships. You have stealth and speed that they can't match.
My speed is true. Hayain desu. But why is it that they choose battleships for Kure? Am I not battle ready?
You're more than battle ready. Respectfully, I think you're underestimating how important intelligence-gathering missions can be. Consider, what might be happening elsewhere?
Not much that I know of that they would require battleships of all things in Kure. Totemo keihaku dessho?
I-7, please. We're out here, there's nothing that can change that. Now we just have to deal with what we can. Besides, Hokkaido is in trouble. We must defend Japan.
Sou da ne. Tashika ni ne? Hm... I still am not quite sure what they could possibly need me for... *Swoosh* Ore wa anata wo motte iru yo! Ha! *Slice*
Wha!? I didn't even see that Morgana! Battle stations, right away!
Iie... Kanchou... Hmph! Kenka shitai yo. Ikuze!
@BATTLE
So this is Aomori. The Morganas haven't hit it as hard as they might've.
Perhaps we can wipe out these northern Funayūrei here and get back to Kure before anything can go wrong there.
Ah... the Bakumatsu was such a glorious and yet unhappy time. Have you read about the Boshin Sensō? The Seinan Sensō? Wars that turned the wheel of history.

Fields.MenuText: Indeed. And in such a short time, relatively speaking.
I wonder if Emperor Meiji would make of our war.
Any ambivalence? You obviously have some affection for the age of the samurai.

Fields.DialogueText: Victory with speed, Kanchou! A fast warrior can precisely cut the air if needs be. Such as how waves ebb and part for my arrival! Umi ga watashi o demukae tte!
Kanchou, how many times have I told you to refer to the Emperor as "His Imperial Majesty?" At the same time... Shirakanai desu. I do not believe he could have expected such peril...
Such heroes were prevalent back then. But... they did not know how to fight on water!
Well, if nothing else, our trip to Hokkaido gives you the chance to see some Boshin War sites - albeit from a distance. You can mark the last stand of the Ezo Republic and the Shinsengumi.
And their final great leader. Oni No Fukucho...
The "Demon Vice Commander." You know of him, I-7?
Shitteiruno!? Of course I know of him! Toshizō Fukucho is someone I aspire to be like! Fierce in battle, loyal to Nihon, adapting with battle, and never retreating! Hijikata was a warrior!
Well, this is the first time I've heard you speak so passionately about someone other than the Emperor.
(Oh, thank goodness, you haven't heard me talk about you...)
Well, there's some time before we fully get stocked here in Aomori, care to practice with me, I-7?
Ready your bokuto, Kanchou. I shall show you exactly what I have been working on!
That sounds like the I-7 I know. Let's- Actually, you might want to pull out Koukinjitsu.
Eh? Kore nani? Why so, Kancho- Oh. How did they get here!? There are supposed to be turrets along the edges of the bay leading up to Hokkaido!?
Evidently they didn't work.
@BATTLE
Sorry. They've been tracking *this* lot all the way from the Tsushima Strait. They may be rendezvousing with our targets, but they're not the main force.
Which is threatening what? Half-frozen beaches and roaming packs of barbarians?
These *are* Japanese citizens you're talking about.
Yet they can't be bothered to learn Japanese customs! We've given them the chance to modernize, and they insist on being...

Fields.MenuText: Themselves?
I'd choose your words carefully here.
It's beside the point, I-7. We're after the Morganas, not civilian populations.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not saying anything you wouldn't hear from the government, or from people on the street in Tokyo, Kanchou.
These people have so far to go before they can fit in with their neighbors to the south. And the ones we're talking about sound more like Jōmon-era indigents than inhabitants of the 20th century.
The great mission of the Meiji era is still unfinished to the north, Kanchou.
"Fukoku kyōhei?"
Indeed!
Don't like this mist, though.
... I must confess, I do quite like Takeda Shingen.
Yes... Kanchou. I believe that I would like to learn the ways of being a true commander. But... my Tennin-Rishin Ryu is still rusty.
But he was Shinsengumi. He fought *against* the Meiji Restoration.
That doesn't take away from his quality, Kanchou.
Rrrgh... Why must it be storming!? I want to taste the sun. Coming here was a mistake...

Fields.MenuText: Calls for some cocoa, don't you think?
Come now, I-7. Now's the time for a bit of indoor fun.
Would you like to play Hanafuda?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, this is not the time for- Er, what is this? It is hot... but it is also chocolate? What is... Hm. Well...
Go on, try it!
Hm... Gochisosamadeshita. *gulp* *gulp* ... Ah! C-Chotto atsui!!! Demo, oishii! Mecchya oishi desu yo! Aha, Kanchou, you've done a marvelous job!
Takes a bit of the edge off, doesn't it? Sometimes you just have to take it slow when you're in trouble.
Indoor fun!? What type of indoor fun could there be- Hm, I suppose I could do some arrangement of my art. Oh! Maybe some tennis, or perhaps...
Kanchou, do you even know where we-!! ... Did you get new cards? Nani? Kore wa genteiban desu ka? These are so pristine... I... I suppose I could play a few hands, perhaps it wouldn't hurt?
It is quite-- Eh! Kanchou! We cannot simply slack off! We must find a place to surface so we can gain our bearings!
It'll be all right, I-7 - after all, we not only have your senses, we have compasses and a map. We also have periscopes as well. The storm's strong, so the Morganas won't be able to get at us easily.
But Kanchou, not training during wartime is disgraceful!
You've been training all morning, I-7. You can afford to rest.
Rest is for those without responsibility and those who have done enough for the day. I have not done enough yet, Kanchou!
Yes, you have, I-7. You've already drilled the submarines, made sure to check everything is in working order, and for some reason you've been peeking into my quar-
Ah, ah, ah! C-Chotto matte! Hmph! I still do not like this idleness. (How could you see me..?) What if we are attacked alone?
This is Ezo. The Vice Commander's spirit will protect us, I'm sure. Perhaps this blizzard is his 'warm welcome' to the island.
I wonder. Do you think that Hijikata Toshizō would have liked to play-- Hm!? Kanchou, did you--
I did. Are we... under Morganas? We must be. I-7, increase speed, turn 50, and prepare to surface. Looks like the Morganas are already here.
For the Vice Commander! Ooooooaaaah!!!
@BATTLE
Calm down! Calm down! There will be fighting within the main mission, soon. I demand order! Mi wo tomette!
"We've come to fight!" "Why are we hesitating!?" "This accursed island..." "What is Kanchou doing!?" "Fight, fight!" "Kenkashittayo!!!"
*STOMP*
(Silence falls over the submarines.)
If you all intend to behave like little kodomo, then I will not hesitate *Schwing* to discipline you. Me wo tomero yo. Wakarimashita ka?
"Hai, wakarimasu!" "Yes Taichou!" "Hai..." "We should train some more!" "Let us depart." "Hai, hai, hai."
Mou... Sono teido desu ka? Such a farce. I must exercise more.

Fields.MenuText: They're really noisy lately.
Don't worry, I-7. You did your best.
Care for an exercise partner?

Fields.DialogueText: I have not been able to settle them down, Kanchou! It is as if they are possessed by the Oni... Hijikata Fukucho demanded respect, and yet I cannot get any...
I wish I could have done more, Kanchou. These damn brats, thinking that they can just usurp the rule of their Fukucho simply because I have gone so- A-Ah! Hmph!
I would like to do some curls and perhaps some pull ups. Mou... Kanchou, these submarines are going to give me an upset stomach. This is awful. Thank you for offering, though. I-I would love to.
It would appear the submarines share your sentiment about Hokkaido. But unlike them, you know it's a mission and you're treating it well.
I have decided the statement of the only Amerikajin I respect.
Who would that be, I-7?
William Smith Clark, of course. He reinvigorated farming, taught children, and of course, left with the immortal words: Shonen yo! Taishi wo idake! The legendary Amerikajin of Sapporo University.
"Boys, be ambitious!" Huh, that's actually quite the statement to live by. I may have to do more research into Clark. There's been some interest among the crew in flower arrangement and growing food.
Ah, we could do something like that inside! I would love to help you grow some plants, Kanchou! Oh, let me show you to my flower arrange--
Huh... Did you hear that? It sounded like a moan.
Ack! I know that moan! Funayūrei dekita! Come, Kanchou! We need to confront them right away!
@BATTLE
Come! Come! I will slash through each *Slice* and *Slice* every *Slash* one of you!
Be careful, I-7, a snowstorm is rolling in again!
Kusora! Mada jūbun Morgana no chi o yūshinai! Submarines, part! Let me get closer!
Guh! I-7, we're breaking away from the pack, please be careful!
Why are you running, Funayūrei? Doushite hashiru no ka!? Doushite!? Stand and fight!
We're too far into the snowstorm..!
Daijyoubu yo, Kanchou! This Morgana is mine! Haaah! *Slash* Hmph! Got you!
Navigation! Please get us back on bearings, we need to regroup!

Hahahaha! To think, an impudent whelp like you could escape I, I-7? Bakame. Why would Hokkaido be worried about you? I have conquered... Hm? Kanchou... Watashitachi wa doko ni imasu ka? (Where are..?)
Damn! We're flying blind, hold on—I-7! Reroute immediately!
Where are... Ah!? Ichi, ni, san... H-Have I... Have I fallen into a trap?
Come on, I-7! Snap out of it! Let's do our best! Kakugo shina!
@BATTLE
Knuurrgh! Hah... Hah... Yabe... Kanchou, moshiwaki gouzaimasen! I-I shouldn't have...

Fields.MenuText: It's all right. We made it out together.
I got to see that blush of yours, so it wasn't so bad.
Got a bit excited, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: Knunugh... Uruse! I-I simply got ahead of myself... I hope the other submarines are all right. A-Are you all right, Kanchou? You are not hurt, are you?
Mou..! Mienai! Hazukashiyo! P-Please do not look upon me! Rrrgh! My apologies, Kanchou. Are you unhurt? Please tell me you that you are not hurt! I-I could never forgive myself if I-
S-Sou desu. Mou... Kanchou, my deepest apologies. I got ahead of myself and all out of balance. Please tell me that you are unharmed, please! If needed, I will take care of your wo-
I'm fine - don't worry. Are you all right?
I'm f-fine... kuh! Gah... I-Ittai...
Come on, I-7. We've got radio contact with a port nearby. Once we get there, I'll make sure you're taken care of, all right?
(K-Kanchou is holding my hand... Mou... B-But, I do not dislike it.) Arigatou yo, Kanchou.
Kuh... M-My wounds still sting...
Do you need my shoulder, I-7? We should be getting pretty close to port.
S-Such pity to be offered to a warrior is unbecoming. I am strong enough to protect K-Kure! I... *grunt* can take care of myself! I-Ittai...

Fields.MenuText: Here. Please drink, I-7.
(Comfort I-7)
A true warrior accepts the hand of a fellow warrior.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah... *gulp* I do love this hot chocolate as you called it. A-Arigatou gozaimashita. K-Kanchou, please do not worry about me too much. I-I am strong.
Kanchou, what are you...? A-Are you rubbing my back? Hah... Hm... Kore kimochi wa... iidesu. Such warmth... P-Please, Kanchou, you waste such affections on me; I am but a warrior.
B-But! Hijikata Fukucho did not accept anyone else's hand! Y-You cannot just... Hm... This is embarrassing, Kanchou. I-I should be stronger.
Even the strongest warrior is still mortal. Besides, I-7, I am your Kanchou. It is my responsibility to care for you. So please, relax yourself.
Arigatou, Kanchou. Kuh... If only this damned snowstorm moved out of the way.
If only, huh? Hm? Communications? What is it?
Gomen, Kanchou! There are Morganas ahead of us, but we haven't been spotted!
Now it's our turn to trap them, then. Take it easy for this battle, I-7. All right? You may command your submarines as you wish, but please don't hurt yourself.
K-Kanchou... (Goodness... Such sincerity!) I-I will remain. Hai.
@BATTLE
I was expecting more from them. Zannen datta.
Darou na? I suppose they just chose to lay down and- Hm? The snowstorm is clearing..!
Otaru..? Majide!? How did we e-end up all the way over here!? K-Kuh...
Full of spirit even when you're hurt! Haha! I wish I had your energy, I-7. But don't strain yourself now. We'll pull into port now and get you looked at.
Huh. If I'm not mistaken, we were near Otaru this whole time.
Just relax and lean on me, okay?
Yooooosh! Hmhmhm! Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou. That was just what I needed. And now it is time for us to do our mission here.
Back in top form again, that's what I'm talking about. All right, time to defend this port for a bit. Hopefully, the freighters won't encounter much trouble.
Defending freighters..!? Majide..? That is correct, but to be defending such lowly ships is beneath me. Not to mention how *frustrating* this snowstorm is!
I've heard it's gotten so bad that people can't even leave their homes. Still, we need to make sure this supplies gets to them - they'll die if we don't.
Or maybe some of the Ainu will have to give up their primitive ways and improve their way of living! But... the regular people here deserve better. Rrrgh... Kuso samui yo.
It's cold, isn't it? Do you have a jacket?
I do not! I only have my armor. However, I would not be opposed to getting a jacket if I were to remain here for long.
I'll see if I can find you one, or perhaps have the locals at Sapporo make you one. I've heard they're quite good at it.
Mou, Kanchou, you should not spend your money so frivolously on me- G-Guh! The snowstorm is picking up again!?
That's not all! Morganas are coming, and the freighter's trying to get away!
Then, let's intercept! Ike!!
@BATTLE
Hm? I don't remember us firing an explosive salvo like that.
A-Aoi irodatta ka? D-do I fire blue torpedos?

Fields.MenuText: No - though I'm sure you'd make them look amazing.
Perhaps your sword swept up the ocean?
A flicker of the snowstorm, perhaps?

Fields.DialogueText: K-Kanchou!!! Nani wo hanasette!? M-Mou... Arigatou. B-But, who fired such a salvo?
While Koukinjitsu is strong, I still have a long way to go before I perform such feets. Who fired that salvo?
Can snowstorms become blue? P-Perhaps it would make for a nice evening! Chotto! I did not fire such a shell! Dare desu ka?!
I don't know- Hm? There are some cannons set up on the bay... They look odd. Communications, do you have an identification on those?
It's... kind of unclear, Kanchou. But the word from Sapporo is that it may be the locals.
Now there's something you don't see everyday! Send them thanks for us, will you?
(Knunurgh..! Onore! Those damned Ainu, stealing *MY* Kanchou's attention! I-I'll show them..!) W-What a surprise! Shall we guide the ship, Kanchou?
By all means. Let's get them safely home.
The Ainu?
Hai.
Mudi... Ohayou gozaimasu, Kanchou.
Are you all right? You look exhausted!
It is the submarines. They will not cease their incessant bickering. I grow deaf listening to them!

Fields.MenuText: Unruly children, it sounds like.
Submarines quarreling? This is a new one.
Lay down a bit, I-7. You look like you might collapse...

Fields.DialogueText: Unruly!? I had to stop two of them from blowing each other out of the water! They share in my sentiment, and while I appreciate that, this is completely out of line! Mou... Dousuruba ii no ka?
It is more than quarreling. There was going to be a full out war between six submarines before I managed to break them apart. Not even I-66 is this incompotent! Grrgh... What should I do?
I-I... Kanchou, what has gotten into you lately!? (Kanchou is so worried about me... M-My heart is...) Those submarines will tear each other apart if I do not act!
Take it easy, I-7. I'm sure that we can address the submarines' concerns. We'll do it together. For right now, you should rest yourself for a moment.
I will not sit idly by and let those damned Ainu do my job!
We'll find out. I want to arrange a meeting and see if I can get into their headspace.
Meeting with the Ainu aboard m-me!? K-Kanchou, you cannot! I forbid it! I will show you just how strong I am!
I-7, wait!
Nonsense! I will show you that I am strong enough to handle this! I am in top form! I will not..! K-Kuh..! The snowstorm again..! Nandatouuuu!? N-No! I will not be shown up! Taste my steel!
I-7! Wait! Please, you're going to hurt yourself!
Uraaaaaagh!!!
@BATTLE
More weapons support from Hokkaido. Interesting.
K-Kuh..! N-No! S-Shown up by those damn barbarians again..!
I-7, please. Please. You are not going to be replaced by them. I promise. Please just hold back.
K-Kanchou...
Are you... crying, I-7?
Urusai! Shinne! K-Kuh...

Fields.MenuText: (Hug I-7)

Fields.DialogueText: (I-7 sobs loudly, but reciprocates.)
As a rule, when we come across homegrown civic defenses that can take the fight to the Morganas, I find it's wise to take the help.
... But, yeah, I don't expect to see small, isolated communities in possession of Morgana-killing weapons.
Exactly! They must have stolen them from the Army! Or been colluding with the Soviets!
T-This is such a farce. Kanchou, dousuruba ii no ka?
Kanchou, this blizzard is..!
Come on, I-7! I know you can do it! It's not a contest, it's you!
Kanchou...! Y-Yosh! Todoke!
@BATTLE
Fuuu~n... Kore ga owarida. Tattsunaizo, zako ga. ... Ah... I cannot feel my arms. B-But I did it! I worked with... everyone...

Fields.MenuText: (Headpat I-7)
(Kiss I-7 on the cheek and hug her)
(Hoist I-7 onto your shoulders and cheer loudly for her.)

Fields.DialogueText: H-Huh!? Kanchou, d-do not... H-Hmmm... A-Arigatou. Honto ni arigatou... (Why does this feel so... good?)
Uwaaaha!? K-Kuh..! (D-Did Kanchou just..!?) Atatakai yo... Hah... Totemo ureshii—E-Eh!? (Please. Let all the kami spare me, tell me that I did not just say that out loud!?)
Fuee!? K-Kanchou! Put me down! Oittekudasai! Oittekudasai yo!!! Kuyashi!!! (B-But... Kanchou is so happy. Why is my heart..?) This is-!!! Too high!!!
Sorry, I-7. I got ahead of myself. I'm just so proud of you. You went ahead and did your best without hunting for the glory. You deserve it.
Kanchou... A-Arigatou gozaimasu.
Ojyamashimasu. That was stellar fighting, Onimusha-san.
Onimusha jyanai yo! Onimusha jyanai iin desu yo na! I am I-7! Who are you!?
Ah. Sumimasen. I am Matsui Yumiko. Yoroshiku onegaishimasu. It is a pleasure to meet you, I-7, and Kanchou.
S-Such manners from an Ainu! Y-Yorshiku onegaishimasu. Watashi wa I-7 desu. Kore wa Kanchou desu. Yoroshiku, yoroshiku...
You'll have to forgive her, Yumiko-san. She's a bit frazzled. *Chuckle* Thank you so much for your assistance. You and your neighbors have been helping us quite a bit here.
Iie. We should be thanking you and I-7, Kanchou. We have had to defend this port for ourselves for the last month. You are the first they've sent from Kyushu to take care of this.
Please continue assisting us, Kanchou, I-7-san. Now, forgive me, I must depart. My family and friends need my help back on shore.
Well now! How about that!
Majide... Kanchou..?
What is it, I-7?
May we rest for the rest of the day? I believe I have seen one too many things to disrupt my world today.
Of course, I-7. You've more than earned it.
I'm sorry for that. It took us a while to fight our way here.
You've done an excellent job of defending yourselves, though. The torpedoes you've been firing - from land...
Salvaged. From the remains of... one of them.
That's... potentially really valuable. Are they safe to use?
Oh, no. Not at all. And we have almost exhausted them.
We'll gather up whatever medical supplies and food we can spare for you, for what it's worth. And we'll talk again soon.
To be woken up so early is... *Yawn* regrettable. But, a true warrior must be ready for anything. Where are we going, Kanchou?
Sorry. I didn't mean to ruin your rest. But, unfortunately, we've received a distress call from Kushiro. There is heavy fighting about and the port is in grave danger.
Wha!? Kushironoka!? That is incredibly far, can we even make it in time!?
Yumiko said that we should be fine, and that they still have the resources to protect this stretch of the coast a little bit longer.
Still, Kushiro!? How do they expect us to reach Kushiro when we are barely out of Uchiura Bay! And in this weather? We will not make it there for another day!

Fields.MenuText: Luckily, I have the fastest submarine.
Fujin and Raijin, in the middle stands Kouryu.
With you? We might as well be already there.

Fields.DialogueText: The fastest!? Hoh... Kanchou..! Kanchou wa watashi o atsuku shita yo! Time to go full speed ahead!!!
Comparing me to Kouryu..!? K-Kanchou, you cannot just..! Mmm! I will go fast! I will be faster than Raijin's lightning!
H-Holding me in such high regard! T-Then..! Oshikunaiyo! Ike! Hayaku, hayaku, hayaku!!! Kushiro will come into our vision so fast that the Morgana will not have time to react!
That's the way! Let's get it!
They will see my true power!
Huh, we are going quite fast. The other submarines are having some trouble keeping up!
If they want to quarrel, then they can keep up.
We're coming up on Hidaka soon. All's good for... Huh? Another snowstorm?
Kuh! Kore no toki, watashi wa totonotte iru yo! Submarines! Ketsudan shiro!
YOSH! KETSUDAN SHIMASU!
Looks like they're here...
They will not be for this world for long! Yosh! Zenshiiiiiinnnn!!!
UOOOOAHHHHH!!!!
@BATTLE
But we have things to do on our end first - so our job is just to move as soon as we can.
"A little bit longer?"
Yeah. As I understand it, they're going to have to see if they can salvage more munitions from their beached Morgana sooner rather than later.
I'm hoping we can rendezvous with them there - they've done a hell of a job on their own, but civilians and Morgana tech usually don't mix well in the end.
What an utter mess... Those battles were all over the place in the snowstorm. Fubuki itsu wa owaru no ka? Will it last forever?
I doubt it. You did your best in those battles, I-7. However, it would appear that we're approaching Kushiro!
Mazui..! The snowstorm is getting worse! B-But, I can see them!
And they can't see us... Which means...
Suwatte iru ahiru ga. I will enjoy this.
@BATTLE
So this is Kushiro...
Hm. Aside from a few buildings, it has handled itself rather well. Where are the defenders?
Last I checked most of them wanted to help clean up the city. They take a lot of pride in their home, it seems.
It is... rather pretty in the snow. Along with the morning sun... H-How beautiful.

Fields.MenuText: It'd be a nice spot for a date, don't you think?
I'll bet people come down here to make wishes together.
Lounging together in summer nights must be incredible.

Fields.DialogueText: D-Date!? Y-Yes I suppose it would. You have all the makings of a romantic spot here, no? W-Well, there are a few things missing but...
Wishes? ... Perhaps. It is said that the ocean can bring many things from afar. I wonder if it would grant me some of mine?
... (With Kanchou... Oh, why must Kanchou fill my head with such imagery?) Quite so. Playing in the sunset, surfing until the moon rises, and then eating aisu when it becomes too warm...
And you thought Hokkaido was going to be a waste of your time...
Ma... Watashi wa omotta. I pegged this place for no more than a podunk. Yet, when I could see those mountains when we passed Hiroo, I was smitten.
The north brings tidings, doesn't it? ... Oh, I-7. One of the locals brought us ice cream. Care to-
M-Mochiron!!!
*Chuckling*
We do have a prospective volunteer - somebody with medical experience, as I understand it.

Fields.MenuText: But they probably need her more here.

Fields.DialogueText: It really does look like it's a nice place to live when it isn't getting shelled, huh?
So, Mombetsu, is it? Is that our next place of protection?
Indeed. There are some supplies from Anchorage that are supposed to be coming in in three days time. If we don't clear out that port, they'll be in trouble.
The Amerikajin helping us? Ha! They control resources that should be ours and expect us to thank them for sharing?
At this point we're all literally fighting the Morganas together.
Ah. Kore da. It strikes me as odd, but let us proceed.

Fields.MenuText: The war may be still going, but saving the world's a group effort.
Sometimes, you need a little help.
I gave you my hand, I-7.

Fields.DialogueText: The Morgana are but a temporary distraction. When the war should continue, I will make sure the enemies of Nihon are made to kneel! B-But... you are correct.
A true warrior can provide for themselves... Y-Yet, I have needed help for most of this journey. Perhaps... Perhaps I am the one who needs help the most?
K-Kanchou! It was warm in mine... B-But... Hai, wakarimashita. P-Perhaps being helped is not as bad as it seems?
If you cannot protect what you have today, you may as well not see tomorrow. I would like to see this world. And I'd like to keep seeing you, I-7.
K-Kanchou... So would—Eh!? Oh... Omae! Who did that!? Kimi wa nani ni shiteru!? O-Oh..! It is the submarines again!
I knew you said it was bad, but they're ramming into one another! We have to break them appart!
Yamero! Yamero! Yamero omae! Do you know what you two are doing!? Stop this nonsense at once, or you will be held to the highest degree of—GAH!? N-No! Fubuki detta!
Kanchou to other submarines, cease this, immediately! The blizzard is rolling in, we have a mission!
"Omae!" "Kusora!" "Kore ga inu da!" "Kurosuzo!" "Yattemiro!" "Ano yaro..!" "I'll tear you to pieces!" "Stupid pissant!"
Damn it! They won't listen!
Yamero! Yameroooo!!! Bakamono! Why are they doing this!? Why are they doing this no—Ugh! A-A salvo!?
The Morgana are all around us... This is bad! Ah! At that submarine, that salvo will..!
Ugoke! Ugoooke!!! Uwaaa! No... No, no, no, no!
Son of a bitch, that's a direct hit... It's sinking!
No..! No! Why!? Why did you all..!? Why will you not listen to me!? Bakayarou!!! *Sniffle* I-Iyada...!
I-7! We have to move! Please, get ready for battle!
Grrr..!!! Omae wa inochi ga **moratta!!**
@BATTLE
Move! Move!!!
"This is all your fault, you bastard!" "My fault!? You were the one who let them die!" "You want a piece of me!?" "You..!"
For everything! Please! Yameroooo!!!
I-7! Look out!
Geh! Dodged... A-Ah! *I-7 lets out a wailing scream.*
That's two more... Grgh! I-7, with me! We have to destroy these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Yoyuu daze! All targets destroyed! ... Damn it. I-7...
K-Kanchou... I...
Are you all right, I-7? Are you hurt anywhere?
Itte... Itte yo... Why, Kanchou? Why would they not listen to me? Five of them are gone now... Five of them are gone!
I-7... Please, it's not-
Yes it was, Kanchou! I was a weak leader! I-I have failed..! I am not fit to be in charge of others..! I-I am..! W-Warui..! Iji warui yo..!
I-7!! Listen to me. Look at me.
K-Kanchou..!!
It's not your fault. It isn't. It was their fault for fighting and they got themselves killed. You even gave your orders and tried actively to stop them—you did all you could!!!
Kanchou... Kanchou! *I-7 holds onto you while burying her face in your shoulder.* P-Please..! Make the pain stoooop!!! Why!? Why is so haaaaard!?

Fields.MenuText: (Hug her and remain silent and let her cry.)
(Hug her.)It's ok. It's ok. It's ok...
(Hug her, and sing the song of cherry blossoms.)

Fields.DialogueText: K-Kanchou..! Why!? After everything I've tried to do..! Why!? All I've done is get others killed! The Ainu have done more than me! Why..! I am a failuuuuure!!! *Sobbing*
*I-7 sobs loudly.* Please, Kanchou! P-Pleaaase do not leave me either! Please!!! Please... Onegai..! I am sorry!!!
This is..! Kanchou... It hurts..! B-But..! *I-7 continues to sob.* Why..!? Even the cherry blossoms..! Even so..!
I promise you, I-7. I will stand by you. We will get through this. I promise I won't leave. I promise. You are stronger than this.
(You hug her tightly as she cries into your shirt.)
Fubuki detta. Hm...
What's wrong, I-7?
... Kore! *Slice*
Wha!? Another Morgana!? Why are there so many..?
Hm... Yokanshitteiru... I have a feeling about something. Kanchou, jyuunbi wa ii?
Let's go.
@BATTLE
I thought making it to Mombetsu would've fixed most things. It evidently didn't. Are you holding up well, I-7?
Hai. I feel... better now that we have given those submarines proper respect in death. Mombetsu is quite nice, but something irks me.

Fields.MenuText: Those scallops they gave us felt kind of off...
The snowstorms just don't seem to be stopping.
Death lingering in the air is easy for no one.

Fields.DialogueText: No it is not. Yet, that is not the reason I am irked. There is something about these snowstorms that strikes me as... off. It feels like such opportune timing.
It is almost as if they come and go with when something direct happens. I am beginning to believe that these are not incidental.
They were brined! Kanchou, this is *not* the time to be thinking on food! These snowstorms seem unpredictable, yet something about their appearance is off!
I tend to agree. But this isn't the usual Morgana weather manipulation, as far as I can tell. There's no fixed center, there are no weird machines...
I wonder if the Funayūrei weapons those Ainu salvaged might contain a clue. What is the status of Yumiko, do you know?
She was heading north. Near Wakkanai.
Kore wa... Could it be...? Kanchou, we must meet her immediately.
The course should already be set.
Hai. I will take your hand this time and lead you to Wakkanai!
You're gripping me really tightly, I-7... Well! Lead the way!
Let's make haste, I-7.
Kuh! The snowstorm is strong here! Mecchya tsuyoin da! B-But! There they are!
And our friends are putting up a hell of a fight. Wakkanai is being thoroughly defended... for as long as their ammunition holds out.
Let us he-
"It's freezing!" "I want to go back!" "I would sooner die than go back!" "Are you some sort of loyal?" "Are you calling me a bootlicker!?" "I know what I-"
Ah, damn it. Not again-
*Slice*
"Uwaaa!" "Woah!" "The sea parted!" "Wha..!" "Friendly fire..? What is this!?"
Damare. (Be silent.)
*Complete silence.*
Wareware wa Taichou. Your orders are from we alone. I will no longer tolerate any insubordination nor infighting. Do you remember what happened to your comrades earlier?
*Murmuring*
I said. Damare. *STOMP* We are here to help Hokkaido and those Ainu. Our mission is to defend. If we find that any of you are continuing your infighting, you will suffer our wrath. Kikoeru?
Kikkimasuyo, Taichou. Moushiwaki gozaimasen.
Annoying... Hmph!

Fields.MenuText: I *do* like seeing you take control.
And thus, her words were like the golden dragon.
(Applaud)

Fields.DialogueText: K-kanchou! There is no need to praise me for doing my duty!
The golden dragon is strong with my blade. With the courage you have given me, I will make this battle ours.
From the honor to me given by Kanchou, I shall win!
Okay, then.

Hai. Mitte! The enemy is before us. Therefore, we will make them an example of what will happen to those who defy the will of His Imperial Majesty! Raise high! 
Zenshin!
With Taichouuuuuuu!!!!
@BATTLE
The snow wets my blade... and my blade thirsts for these vile Funayūrei!

Fields.MenuText: So, when do we write our fairytale?
That's the way, I-7!
Let both our voices join in unison!

Fields.DialogueText: Saying such things, even when we are locked in battle! Mou... My Kanchou is so difficult! But together we are an impassible wall!
Do not let them get an inch! Our courage together is strong, Kanchou! You fill me with life! Together we will conquer!
Hai! Our hearts shall sing in this setsugekka! Waga wa tsurigi da!!! With my hands and Kanchou's!
I will stand by your side, I-7! Wakkanai won't fall to these clowns!
@BATTLE
From the dew of the snow, thus laid a field of corpses at my feet. Hmph! I suppose that is that.
Omingotou, I-7. Hm? Oh! Yumiko!
Yumiko-chan!? You made it all the way out here!?
Mochiron. Though, consider me surprised, I did not expect you all to come this way and help us! You have my deepest gratitude.
Yumiko. Where is the dead Funayūrei? We must solve the mystery of these snowstorms, and it may offer some clue.
Ah! Right. I-7, Kanchou, since you have both proven yourselves more than one could think about... That settles it! Please accompany us to Rishinfuji, we need you!
Rishinfuji? Isn't that that remote island off the coast of here?
Indeed. Most of my friends are gathering there, but we need your help to defend us. These yuurei must know what we're doing!
Right. I-7, are we ready to go?
Hai! Right away!
You're very welcome. And I can think of a way you could help us in return...
Rishinfuji is ahead! But..!
"But" nothing! Funayūrei! Get out of the way!
@BATTLE
Not even worth the effort! Hanashinaranda! But at last... we are here.

Fields.MenuText: This is beautiful.
You've fought so hard, I-7.
(Hug I-7)

Fields.DialogueText: Such beautiful peaks and trees... It is our efforts that led us here. And soon, it is our efforts that will protect Hokkaido. Kanchou... Honto ni arigatou.
I have fought many battles. Tsukareruyo. But, I have come this far with you, Kanchou. I am not about to leave. Honto ni arigatou. You have kept by me.
K-Kanchou! Not in front of the Ainu, please! Rrrgh! H-Hmph. Well, it is the result of our great battles that have brought us here. You have given me courage, Kanchou. Honto ni arigatou.
Your thanks are my thanks to you, I-7. You've done wonderfully, but our battle isn't over yet.
Look over there.
Is that...? It must be the wrecked Funayūrei. But...
But it hasn't been blown up by conventional weapons. It's just... twisted.
More than that, Kanchou. It seems unfinished. Or - you see that steam there?
Is it steam or is it mist?
I'm not sure it's technically either. I think it's a byproduct of the Funayūrei just... disintegrating.
Okay, we need to radio our Ainu friends and tell them to keep their distance. I don't know what this thing is, but it's INPF property now.
Kanchou?
Yes?
Thank you for convincing me not to stay in Kure.
Thank you for not making me swim out here on my own.
(Invited to Kanchou's quarters? I know I shouldn't make too much of it, but...)
*KNOCK*
Come on in, I-7. Please, close the door behind you.
H-hai.
Okay, everything I'm about to say to you is classified. We don't share it with the crew - even the officers. And that comes from on high.
Oh! Oh, I thought... I mean, yes, Kanchou.
What we have disintegrating over on that beach appears to be an unknown, undocumented Morgana.
You know that new types have been manifesting over the last several months?
Well, best guess from the special investigators is that this is one that hasn't quite successfully crossed over from wherever these things come from.
Ahh! Kanchou, we should secure it for study immediately!
We're doing our best. The scientists don't expect anything to be left of the thing after three or four days - but we have more urgent priorities than trying to lock down what we can't keep.
They think there's a chance that we can still interfere with this Morgana's manifestation--
I don't understand.
Sorry. The working hypothesis is that the blizzards are some kind of warning signs that a living version of this Morgana is about to emerge.
When we disrupt Morgana activity in these heavy-snow environments, it's speculated that we're throwing a spanner into the works.
So... we can keep an entire class of Funayūrei from coming into being? Sugoi!
Or at least delay it, and gather more information about how the storms and whatnot work.

Fields.MenuText: If anyone can pull it off, it's you and me.
Our superiors think it's worth a try, anyway.
It sounds more like hope than science to me, but orders are orders.

Fields.DialogueText: There's another set of orders as well.
Kanchou?
The people who've been using the Morgana weapons... we're supposed to secure them. So Japanese authorities and the INPF can evaluate the effects of continued exposure.
Yumiko and her friends... I was impressed by their courage, Kanchou. I'm sure they would want to help the Empire defeat the Funayūrei menace!
We're to use whatever force is required to secure them, to take away their clothes and possessions for separate study, and to make sure it's all done quietly.
Ideally, their families will believe they've been killed - though, if absolutely necessary, we can make it known that they've been detained as a security risk.
Kanchou...
Wait. The enemy is gathering!
I don't often say this, but... that's kind of a relief.
@BATTLE
Samui! Totemo samui!
I haven't felt this much cold before... that dead ship back there must be amplifying the storms somehow!
How I would like a scarf...

Fields.MenuText: Would you like a hug?
If you want, I can give you my jacket.
I promise, I'll make extra hot chocolate tonight.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou is so affectionate..! Perhaps later. Right now, we must focus on the task at hand. L-Later could you hug me for a long time? To think, such sweetness...
Iie! I will not have you freeze, Kanchou! That I solemnly swear! B-But, for you to give the coat off your back for me as a gesture... What is your affection?
Did we get more!? Uwaaah... That excites me. Ureshii yo. Kanchou, just when I think that you cannot make my heart beat strongly, you go and do it again. What... are you, Kanchou?
You should know by now, I-7. But, no matter what, I stand by you. I will. I made that promise.
As will I, Kanchou. ... Hm! Here comes another few!
We're cold. But our greeting will be warm.
@BATTLE
Huh... it's... not cold anymore?
Yes... Ah! I can move! I can move freely through the ice floes! Nani ka!?
The snow, too. It looks different. I can't tell if that's good or bad.
The waters on my hull are so... silky and I can pass through them without any resistance. I have not felt such waters since I went to Honshu...
It feels strangely comforting.
My blade has been wetted with the Funayūrei who took away those five from me. Yet... I no longer feel any anger.
What do you feel, I-7? Is it the same as me? I want to...
...protect-
-you.
Wah! Ko-Kowaii... That is perhaps the strangest I have felt in such a long time.
Kanchou?
Chikushō!
Um... sorry to interrupt. But those Ainu are insistent - there's something going on with the Morgana wreck.
Gojuu! *Slash* Gojuuichi! *Slash* Gojuuni! *Slash* Gojuusan! *Slash*
Are you okay?
They will all suffer! I may have avenged those five, but I will now claim more souls for Koukinjitsu!
On a more positive note, despite the snow it feels like I don't even need to wear a jacket.
I would like to see you without one, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: What's this? I-7 flirting back?
Perhaps I'm rubbing off on you?
Haha! That's a good one, I like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Do not mark me, Kanchou. I am simply playing the game while we have time to do so. Still... I would... Ahem! Y-You know what I am saying?
No! There will be no rubbing. B-But I would not mind cuddling. I simply am following your example. Maybe... Perhaps later we could cuddle.
You really think so? I only came up with that a moment ago. P-Perhaps my feelings are getting the best of me. Then again, Kanchou, the way you...
Mhm! To be honest, I-7. Nothing would do me better than a good night's rest within your company.
It would be a good night for it. Look at what's above us.
... What *is* that?
The Aurora Borealis? We're quite far north, Kanchou...
The Aurora Borealis isn't usually blues and reds. I don't think this is a good thing.
I don't think this is a good thing at all.
@BATTLE
Well, they definitely seem to be coming. The wreck is sending out weird electromagnetic pulses along with the lightshow, and word is that enemy fleets are responding.
If we could figure out how to simulate it, it could be a useful tool.
... Or it could open a gateway to new Morganas, I suppose. I don't often say that I wish the Morgana Research boffins were around, but they'd be handy now.
Kanchou... are we still awake?
Yeah. I think this is a nightmare of the waking variety.
The snow has not ceased. Yet, at times I can see the stars, and they...
They're not right. They *move*. I think our mystery Morgana is trying to come through.
Before the hull on the shore completely vanishes?
Maybe. The radios are almost useless today, so we're not getting expert opinion unless it's from our Ainu friends.
They shouldn't even be here anymore. It's not safe!

Fields.MenuText: I've tried telling them that. They're determined to do their bit.
Having eyes on that wreck is invaluable, though.
I thought you weren't a big fan.

Fields.DialogueText: They don't have the training, though.
I respect their desire to serve! But they don't have the training for this task.

Fields.MenuText: Look at the sky again. Nobody's trained for this.
They're hunters and they know the area. I can't think of better training.
I've tried telling them that. They disagree.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you don't want to lose anyone else. I don't either.
@BATTLE
... But as long as they're serving a vital combat function I can defend not detaining them onboard.
What's to stop them from just slipping away when the shooting stops, Kanchou?
... That almost sounds more like a suggestion than a question.
I would never!
You know, you're beautiful when you dissemble.
Kanchou, you mustn't tease me! I--
*BOOM*
Hold that thought.
Have we been drifting off..? What of Rishinfuji!? Kanchou, where are we?!
I'm not sure. The compass is going nuts, and I can't see anything anywhere - but all our forces are accounted for.
Shall we dance under the starlight, I-7?
With pleasure. It is time...
It's possible we've been translocated, but... I think that light over there could be what's left of the mystery Morgana. Can you see better than I do?
... It's like hanabi bursting out of a paper bag, Kanchou.
Vivid image.
Keep trying to re-establish radio contact with Yumiko and her friends on land. If we can get a-
Uso....
What now?
Kanchou, the water around me is starting to freeze.

Fields.MenuText: Just like that?
This may be it. The mystery Morgana's making another push.
Are you okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Kinishinaide kudasai. With you beside me, I could cut through whole icebergs!
Hai. And we can beat it back together!
The temperature's dropping sharply, Kanchou. But don't worry - I can keep you warm.
Everyone on alert. If something big is happening...
Funayūrei incoming!
And there we go.
@BATTLE
Is that the last of them?
My submarines aren't detecting any motion, Kanchou - but the water's still getting colder!
Can you peek outside the hull and get a look at the sky? If the lights are still going nuts--
*BOOM*
What the hell was that?
Kanchou, I think... I think it came from the shore.
I've never seen so many of the things totaled at one time. And the stars, the snow, your sword, and the salvo; all of it. It was... amazing.
I can no longer sense their presence. Perhaps they have learned to stay away?
Maybe. There's certainly nothing left of the mystery hulk to call them in. That last explosion was pretty definitive.
Mission accomplished?
Well, partially. Alas, we failed to secure Yumiko and her friends - I've had to report back to Tokyo that there's reason to believe they were all killed when the Morgana hulk finally blew.
I have never been more wrong about a group of people. Perhaps... I took vengance for the five and the- Kanchou! L-Look... The morning sun...

Fields.MenuText: That's a view and a half.
And thus, the land of the rising sun earns its monniker.
(Hug I-7)

Fields.DialogueText: I... cannot say I have seen such a view before. Something about watching the sun rising up here compared to Kure is... beautiful. The snow sparkles, the water shimmers. But... Kanchou.
Kanchou... Even I will say that that is "corny." Yet, here it feels right. Such a beautiful sun, as if lighting on the snowy land to say thank you. Kanchou... Ano...
Still so affectionate... Hm! What am I supposed to do. But... I do not dislike it. In fact, the sunrise makes it better. Hm, but I know what would do more with this. Kanchou...
What is it, I-7? Did you want to send a message to—Mmph!?
*Chuu~* *Chu-chu...* *Chuu~* Mmmmpa! Hah... Hm! I knew it. You have been eating more of the ice cream, have you not?
... You know, I-7... I really think you've grown a lot; because I'm the one who's at a loss for words now.
Well, Kanchou,.. Five submarines gone, friends with the Ainu made, and now... I finally have the will to say what I need to say. Aishiteru yo. I love you, Kanchou.
I-7... Aishiteru mo. I love you, too. *Hug*
Hmhmhm! It appears I get to be the affectionate one, now. ... Ah, but, Kanchou. May I make another selfish request?
Of course. Name it.
May we just... stay here and finally get some rest together; perhaps cuddle like we promised?
Of course, I-7. I made a promise to stick by you. I intend to keep that.
Hmhm! Tanoshimi mashou. I love you, Kanchou.
And I do you, I-7. I'm so proud of you.
Yokatta...
Enjoying the warmer water?
I wish you could feel it like I do, Kanchou. The sea wraps around me like a blanket.

Fields.MenuText: Don't get too comfortable.
We can't ordinarily take credit for warm weather - but this time we literally fought for it.
Lucky sea.

Fields.DialogueText: K-Kanchou - you must take care with your words! That could have been interpreted as something... lewd.
And fought well!
Never, Kanchou.
If that's a complaint-
N-no.
I'm glad.
I take it you and the other submarines aren't having trouble dodging the Morgana debris?
Hopefully they're halfway to Sapporo by now.
